When I try to run the installation test to verify that JUnit is
properly installed and configured using the command, "java
junit.swingui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests" as described in the
README file in the junit3.8.1 directory, JUnit reports one error, a
ClassNotFoundException for junit.tests.runner.LoadedFromJar. The root
directory for the JUnit installation is C:\Program Files\junit3.8.1.
I've created an environment variable called JUNIT_HOME which has this
path as its value, I've added this variable to the CLASSPATH variable,
and I've added %JUNIT_HOME%\junit.jar to the CLASSPATH as well. I
haven't moved junit.jar anywhere, and using the text-based or
AWT-based test runners makes no difference; I still get the error.
Even if I run the command from C:\Program
Files\junit3.8.1\junit\tests\runner, where I can see
LoadedFromJar.class for myself, I get the same error, and the current
directory (.) is part of my CLASSPATH system variable. Can anyone tell
me what is causing this error?
